New Records: The New York Yankees secured a 4-3 victory over the Kansas City Royals in the 11th inning, extending their lead in the AL East.
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a game-ending infield single in the 11th inning to secure the Yankees' win.
Juan Soto hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the sixth inning.
The game went to extra innings with both teams scoring in the 10th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were aiming to increase their lead over the Baltimore Orioles in the AL East.
The Royals were trying to maintain their position in the wild card race.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone highlighted the importance of the win against a strong Royals team.
Royals manager Matt Quatraro acknowledged the tense and well-pitched game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles lost a walk-off game to the Boston Red Sox in Fenway Park.
The Royals are second in the wild card race with a close gap to the Minnesota Twins.
Others: The game was the second of a three-game series between the Yankees and Royals.
